	Accurate, organised and motivated

Benefits


	HMO cover

	Performance Incentive

        Beyond Credit Limited - We are more than just a financial institution; we are a catalyst for change, focusing on empowering low-income entrepreneurs across Africa.We take pride in being a trusted financial institution dedicated to providing tailored solutions to individual business owners. We understand that every business journey is unique, and we are here to support your dreams and aspirations. We provide affordable and flexible loans tailored to entrepreneurs. Additionally, our loans are backed with insurance to cover risks such as death and fire.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Recovery Officer

	Recovery of classified loans.

	Negotiate work out plans with willing debtors.
	Liaise with branches to manage and monitor non-performing loans.

	Excellent communication skills

	Articulate and result-oriented

Account Relationship Manager Job at Polaris Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Polaris Bank was established by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) on September 21, 2018 to offer commercial banking services to the Nigerian public. The bank commenced services on the same day, having purchased the assets and assumed certain liabilities of the defunct Skye Bank. With a footprint of over 350 branches across the country, Polaris Bank prides itself in delivering exceptional customer experience, leveraging best in class/state of the art Information Communication Technology (ICT).

By focusing on ICT solutions across multiple service delivery channels (mobile banking, ATMs, POS and online platforms) Polaris Bank maintains a pivotal role in the Nigerian banking industry, providing customers with simple, convenient and secured banking services.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Relationship Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

About the job


	The ideal candidate will be able to appropriately identify the needs of both new and current customers in order to aid customers in their success using our product.
	This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.


Responsibilities


	Work cross functionally within the company to communicate with all stakeholders in customers' success
	Create and maintain relationships with customers to better understand and achieve their needs
	Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform
	Manage all reporting about the health of customers' accounts.


Qualifications


	Previous account management experience
	Articulate and well accustomed to a client facing role
	Willingness and ability to travel.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Chief Operating Officer (COO)",
  "description": "DreamCity Property &amp; Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location:&nbsp;Jabi, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Summary


	DreamCity Group is seeking an accomplished and strategic Chief Operating Officer (COO) to oversee and drive the operational excellence and growth of our diversified portfolio.
	The COO will be responsible for aligning and executing the strategic vision across the companies within the Group. This role demands a dynamic leader with proven experience in operational management, business development, investment strategy, and digital transformation.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure the achievement of the group&rsquo;s business growth targets in alignment with overall corporate goals.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to drive business development, sales growth, and profitability.
	Spearhead the mass adoption of REIT investment&rsquo;s webapp, coordinating strategies to achieve the company&rsquo;s goal of active users.
	Develop and execute investment strategies to maximize returns for investors.
	Manage fundraising activities and investor relations to syndicate capital for real estate investment projects.
	Lead due diligence processes for potential investment opportunities and acquisitions.
	Oversee administrative, sales, marketing, and project management functions, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
	Implement risk management strategies to safeguard investor interests and organizational assets.
	Optimize operational policies and procedures to enhance productivity, streamline processes, and improve efficiency across the group.
	Provide regular reports to the relevant stakeholders on operational performance and progress toward strategic goals.


Requirements


	A Master&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.

Chief Operating Officer (COO) Job at DreamCity Property & Investment Limited




        
    

        
        DreamCity Property & Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Jabi, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	DreamCity Group is seeking an accomplished and strategic Chief Operating Officer (COO) to oversee and drive the operational excellence and growth of our diversified portfolio.
	The COO will be responsible for aligning and executing the strategic vision across the companies within the Group. This role demands a dynamic leader with proven experience in operational management, business development, investment strategy, and digital transformation.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure the achievement of the group’s business growth targets in alignment with overall corporate goals.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to drive business development, sales growth, and profitability.
	Spearhead the mass adoption of REIT investment’s webapp, coordinating strategies to achieve the company’s goal of active users.
	Develop and execute investment strategies to maximize returns for investors.
	Manage fundraising activities and investor relations to syndicate capital for real estate investment projects.
	Lead due diligence processes for potential investment opportunities and acquisitions.
	Oversee administrative, sales, marketing, and project management functions, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
	Implement risk management strategies to safeguard investor interests and organizational assets.
	Optimize operational policies and procedures to enhance productivity, streamline processes, and improve efficiency across the group.
	Provide regular reports to the relevant stakeholders on operational performance and progress toward strategic goals.


Requirements


	A Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of senior leadership experience in operations, business development, or investment management, preferably within the real estate, investment, or hospitality sectors.
	Proven track record of successfully driving digital adoption and managing large-scale user growth initiatives.
	Demonstrated expertise in fundraising, investor relations, and investment strategy execution.
	Strong understanding of regulatory requirements and industry standards in real estate development and financial investments.
	Exceptional leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and guide cross-functional teams.
	Excellent analytical, strategic planning, and communication skills.


Method of Application

title: Job Openings at Peridot Forte Solutions Consulting
content:
Peridot Forte Solutions Consulting was birthed out of the passion to assist and help organization to create a structure and frame work for their businesses thereby achieving high rate of organizational performance and profit. Organization strives achieving high rate of organizational performance and profit.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Account Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Account Officer will manage daily financial transactions and ensure accurate record keeping. The Account Officer will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, processing invoices, managing accounts receivable/payable, and ensuring timely reconciliation.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle daily cash collections, bank transfers, POS transactions, and ensure accurate recording of all financial activities.
	Manage daily accounting operations including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger entries
	Process invoices, verify transactions, and ensure accurate financial recording
	Reconcile bank statements and ledgers to maintain precise financial records
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports
	Serve as primary contact for client billing inquiries and ensure prompt payments
	Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors and suppliers
	Monitor customer accounts for overdue payments and execute collection procedures
	Support budgeting and forecasting processes with accurate financial data
	Identify cost-saving opportunities and improve financial efficiency
	Ensure compliance with statutory legislation and company policies
	Maintain organized digital and physical filing systems for financial documents
	Assist with audit preparations by providing required documentation and support


Requirements


	First Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	2 years of accounting or cashier/reconciliation experience, preferably in a restaurant, hospitality or a related industry.
	Strong knowledge of financial record-keeping, POS systems, and reconciliation processes.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and basic accounting software.
	High level of accuracy, integrity, and attention to detail.
	Strong numerical ability and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage multiple tasks efficiently.


Application Closing Date: 5th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: peridotforte@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Sales & Business Development Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking a candidate who can proactively identify new opportunities and nurture them into lasting, profitable client partnerships.
	The Sales & Business Development Manager is responsible for driving revenue growth by identifying new business opportunities, building and maintaining strong client relationships, overseeing the full sales cycle and developing strategies to increase market share within the industry.


Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities to drive company growth.
	Conduct market and competitor research to support strategic decision-making.
	Generate and manage qualified leads while maintaining an active sales pipeline.
	Prepare and deliver proposals, quotations, and sales presentations to prospective clients.
	Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting to negotiation and closing.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	Follow up on leads, schedule meetings, and document all business development activities.
	Track and report on performance of business development initiatives and recommend improvements.
	Support contract negotiations and ensure timely delivery on client commitments.
	Collaborate with internal teams to align solutions with client needs.
	Represent the company at meetings, events, and networking engagements.
	Prepare weekly and monthly business development reports for management.


Requirement


	First Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or related fields (Master’s degree or professional certification is an added advantage).
	7 – 10 years experience in sales within the food, hospitality, FMCG, or meat processing industry.
	Minimum of 2 years in a managerial sales role.
	Strong understanding of the Nigerian market, sales dynamics, and industry trends.
	Proven experience in sales research, pipeline management, and converting data into actionable insights.
	Strong network and relationship-management skills with established industry contacts.
	Consistent track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Excellent verbal and written communication, active listening, and presentation abilities.
	Ability to quickly build rapport and maintain professional client relationships.
	Strong analytical skills with experience in market research, sales analysis, and competitor assessment.
	Familiarity with sales measurement tools and go-to-market strategies.
	Strong negotiation, persuasion, objection-handling, and closing skills.
	Self-driven, results-oriented, highly organized, and able to manage time effectively.
	High sense of initiative, accountability, and professional work ethic.


Application Closing Date: 10th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: peridotforte@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Research Assistant / Associate

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time; initial fixed term January 2026 to September 2026, subject to renewal
Work Type: Hybrid

Job Summary


	Our client in the Education and Research industry is seeking a candidate with strong intellectual curiosity, meticulous organizational abilities, and the capacity for independent work in a hybrid, non-office environment.
	The Research Assistant/Associate will support the research, coordination and institutional development activities of the project report and academic manuscripts.
	The role involves research, writing, documentation, communication and structured project support. The work requires intellectual curiosity, strong writing skills, careful organisation and the ability to work independently.
	The successful candidate will contribute to research tasks, draft project documents, coordinate with partners and advisors, and represent the programme in selected engagements in and outside the country.


Key Responsibilities


	Support data collection and basic quantitative tasks using Excel and similar tools (competent quantitative skills highly desirable, or strong willingness to learn).
	Conduct literature and policy research and produce clear analytical notes, briefs and summaries.
	Draft project documents including charters, agreements, memos, meeting notes, dossiers and basic grant materials.
	Coordinate with UK and Nigerian partners, including the project legal advisor, and follow up on agreed actions.
	Map and engage institutional stakeholders, arrange meetings and represent the programme in Abuja when required.
	Support communication tasks, including short web updates and simple project communication outputs.
	Maintain organized project records, correspondence, schedules and supporting documentation (including SLAs).
	Support basic quantitative tasks using Excel or similar tools, including simple tables and data preparation.
	Provide logistical and coordination support for meetings, workshops and stakeholder engagements.


Requirements


	First degree in Law (LLB).
	Experience in public speaking or stakeholder communication.
	Excellent writing and communication skills.
	Strong organisation and time-management abilities.
	Confidence in engaging with institutions and external partners.
	Ability to work independently and manage competing tasks.
	Based in Abuja with ability to attend in-person engagements.
	Some experience with Excel, Stata, R, ATLAS.ti or qualitative software.
	Prior exposure to research administration or grant writing.


Application Closing Date: 5th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV with a brief cover note (maximum one page) and one writing sample demonstrating clarity and analytical ability (will be checked for gen AI use) to: peridotforte@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply
